Principal 26313 Telefone Direto 217500603 Email lmcarrico@ciencias.ulisboa.pt Página Pessoal Carreira Docente Universitário Categoria Professor Catedrático Indicadores ResearcherID Orcid Scopus Google Scholar CiênciaVitae Palavras Chave Acessibilidade Keywords Accessibility Currículo Resumido Luís Carriço is Full Professor at the Department of Informatics, Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon. He is the director of the LASIGE research unit and a senior member the Human Computer Interaction and Multimedia (HCIM) Group. He has a PhD (2000) in Electronic and Computers Engineering, from the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST), Technical University of Lisbon. His main research focus are on extreme human-device interaction, for health, accessibility and emergency scenarios. He has published over 200 refereed technical/scientific papers and book chapters, mostly addressing mobile design and support for cognitive impairments and mobile and web accessibility. He was general and program chair of several relevant conferences, such as W4A, IUI, MobileHCI and CRIWG. He coordinated and participated in several EU and national research projects in those areas (e.g., ACCESSIBLE, GUIDE, InSiThe, QualWeb, AGEISM, ASTARTE, WAI-Tools). He also coordinated and participated in multiple industry funded projects. Overall, between research and industry project he directly managed more than 1 Million Euros of funding. He was appointed for the evaluation of EU project proposals, and ongoing projects, on the e-Inclusion area, including those in ICT and Ageing and e-Health. He was one of the evaluators of Computer Science Greek Research Units (2014).
